distribution_native_art_desc: Abioton africanum is primarily native to southern Africa, including countries such as South Africa, Namibia, Botswana, and Zimbabwe. It is commonly found in arid and semi-arid regions, particularly in savanna and shrubland ecosystems. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low rainfall. It is often seen growing along roadsides, in rocky outcrops, and in disturbed habitats. distribution_introduced_art_desc: Abioton africanum was mainly introduced to new habitats in southern Africa through human activities such as trade and land clearing.
